recent_reviews.title: Testing Again
recent_reviews.review:
Just enough cinematic and directorial flair to make up for the run-of-the-mill spy plot.

Top wins
- 93 minute runtime
- Marisa Abela
- Black Bag becoming a part of my everyday conversations with my wife ("did you eat all of the leftovers we were saving for lunch?" "sorry sweetie, black bag")

recent_reviews.title: Heretic
recent_reviews.review: The curse of the underwhelming third act horror movie continues! Why is it so hard to stick the landing with this genre?

recent_reviews.title: It Happened One Night
recent_reviews.review:
If I start talking to Sarah the way Peter talks to Ellie what do you think would happen?

Also,

Idiot me, seeing Peter eating carrots raw and being called Doc: "I wonder if that is based on bugs bunny" 🤦🏼‍♂️🤦🏼‍♂️🤦🏼‍♂️

Ex Machina and Bodies Bodies Bodies had a baby

recent_reviews.title: Mickey 17
recent_reviews.review:
First off, my utter adoration for Robert Pattinson is reaffirmed (not that it needed any reaffirmation), but that is where my positive commentary ends.

This had me hooked at first with its campy tone and interesting, heady ideas (the many yous you are), but then it didn't follow through on anything, got strange and flat-feeling and lost me completely. It was still entertaining throughout so I'll give it three bags of popcorn.

I also don't need any more Trump-ed up caricatures in the movies I watch - I get enough of that from the news.

Also also the creepers were totally Ohmus

recent_reviews.title: I'm Still Here
recent_reviews.review:
No shade to my girl Mikey, but how tf did Fernanda not win...

MILD SPOILER BELOW

A fire alarm went off in our theater the exact moment that Rubens was being taken away by the police and it interrupted a critical vibe shift.

When we got back in our seats 30 minutes later the restart was abrupt and felt disjointed from the idyllic exposition of the first third of the movie.

recent_reviews.title: A Different Man
recent_reviews.review:
So meta it hurts, so cringe-inducing it kills, and darkly hilarious!

The trailer gives the entire arc of the movie away but I still had fun. Anyway, fuck trailers.

LITTLE SPOILER BELOW

Fun fact: this is the second movie in the past few months I've made Danny (who hates being grossed out) watch that involves someone graphically ripping apart their face or body
